name: No Knead Refrigerator Rolls
author: Debbie Rowe
summary: A light fluffy yeast roll that melts in your mouth.
directions: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water and set aside to proof
In another bowl, mix together sugar, salt, shortening, and  egg with an electric mixer at low speed
Add mixture to yeast, and stir in flour
The last 3 cups of flour will have to be mixed in by hand
Cover dough with a damp cloth, and place in refrigerator
Punch down occasionally as dough rises
You can leave dough in refrigerator overnight
Two hours before baking, shape the dough into rolls
Place on greased pans, baking trays or muffin pans
Bake at 400 degrees F ( 205 degrees C) for 8 to 10 minutes
